text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Jordanian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Crown Prince Hassan and Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi stress during a telephone call the necessity of saving the Middle East peace process.
- Foreign investments in the Amman Financial Market (AMF) total 39.6 million dinars ($56 million) since the start of the year.
- Iraqi ambassador to Jordan gives up his right to become doyen of foreign diplomatic corps based in Jordan in his capacity as the country's longest serving envoy to avoid a political uproar.

- Leading Islamist figure Abdul Latif Arabiat expects the palace to intervene to resume the dialogue between the Islamist movement and the government, which had been suspended after the elections boycott call by the Islamic Action Front (IAF) party.
- Foreign Minister Fayez al-Tarawnah says Prince Hassan held fruitful talks with Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak which resulted in closer cooperation.
